DOC.brief_summary: In order reduce cardiovascular risk , current European guideline recommend diet low saturate fatty acid replacement polyunsaturated fatty acid ( PUFA ) . Polyunsaturated fatty acid classify omega-3 omega-6 . However result recent meta-analyses investigate coronary risk outcome clearly support low intake saturate fatty acid high intake omega-3 omega-6 . The aim study investigate short term effect high intake PUFAs microvascular function , lipid , inflammation cardiovascular risk factor inactive patient increase waistline .
DOC.brief_title: Intervention With Omega Fatty Acids High-risk Patients
DOC.criteria: Waist circumference ≥ 94 cm men ≥ 80 cm woman Physical inactivity ( < 2 h vigorous/active exercise training per week ) Regular use certain prescription medication baseline Severe psychiatric illness Pregnancy Pacemaker implantable cardioverter defibrillator Cigarette smoke Previous coronary intervention Concomitant use dietary supplement Use omega3 supplement baseline Alcohol drug abuse condition associate poor compliance . Scheduled hospitalisation course study . Participation clinical trial last 12 week , prior randomisation . Blood donation within precede 12 week . Diabetes Mellitus Type 1 type 2 Triglycerides > 5 mmol/l Previous bariatric surgery Malabsorption disorder
